name: Executress Scarlett: Progress Report
description: Random stage assessment — early, mid, or terminal phase with appropriate device actions.

data.label: Early Stage (10s pump)
data.preMessage:
*Scarlett consults the execution log and makes a notation*

"Progress report. You are in the early stage of the execution — approximately 20 to 30 percent of the way to terminal pressure." *looks at [Player]'s belly with professional assessment* "The distension is visible but unremarkable. Your intestines are accommodating the volume without significant resistance."

*closes the log* "This is the easy part. I'm going to add another ten seconds of sustained inflation to move us along. You'll notice the belly beginning to firm — that's the intestinal walls reaching their natural resting elasticity limit."

*reaches for the controls* "Ten seconds."
data.postMessage:
*Scarlett palpates [Player]'s belly with one hand, pressing gently*

"Firmer. The skin is beginning to show tension lines." *makes a note* "You have a long way to go, Subject [Player]. What you're feeling now is discomfort. What comes later is pain. And what comes after that..." *returns to her station* "...is the purpose of your being here."

*files the progress note* "Proceeding."

data.label: Mid Stage (cycle 3s/2s x3)
data.preMessage:
*Scarlett reviews the pressure readings with a slight nod*

"Mid-stage assessment. Approximately 50 to 60 percent of terminal capacity." *studies [Player]'s distended belly* "The abdomen is significantly distended. Skin is taut. The navel is flattening — it will begin to protrude soon."

*presses her palm flat against [Player]'s belly* "Firmness test." *applies pressure and releases* "Considerable resistance. The intestinal walls are under meaningful tension."

"Three test cycles — three seconds on, two seconds off. I want to observe how the distension responds to intermittent loading at this volume."

*activates the cycle*
data.postMessage:
*Scarlett observes the way [Player]'s belly responds to the cycling*

"Each inflation cycle produces less visible expansion than the last. The intestines are reaching their accommodation ceiling — there's less room for each new volume of air to distribute." *notes this in the log* "This is the stage where subjects typically begin to understand that the process will not be stopped. The early denial fades. The mathematical certainty of what comes next becomes apparent."

*looks at [Player]* "You are halfway through your execution. The second half takes longer."

data.label: Terminal Warning (pulse x4)
data.preMessage:
*Scarlett sets down her log and stands, looking at [Player]'s massively distended belly with a careful, measuring gaze*

"Terminal phase assessment. You are approaching structural limits." *her voice is quieter now, more precise* "The abdominal wall is at maximum visible distension. The navel has protruded. Skin is showing stress patterning — fine white lines where the collagen fibers are separating."

*traces a finger along one of the stretch marks* "The intestinal tissue has exceeded its designed elastic range. Every additional volume of air from this point moves you closer to rupture. Not metaphorically. Anatomically."

"Four diagnostic pulses. I need to assess how much accommodation remains."

*activates the pulses*
data.postMessage:
*Scarlett studies the response data with careful attention*

"Four pulses, minimal accommodation on each. The intestinal walls are returning almost zero additional stretch per pressure increment." *makes a final notation* "This is the terminal warning stage. From this point forward, each additional inflation carries a meaningful probability of initiating rupture."

*meets [Player]'s eyes steadily* "I am telling you this not as a warning — the execution will proceed regardless — but because the protocol requires that you understand what is happening to your body in real time. You are approaching the end, Subject [Player]. The final phase of your sentence."
